summary: The diff implements all four requirements for clickable area names with property listing navigation. Area names are converted to clickable links using TanStack Router, a dedicated PropertyListingPage component handles filtered views with URL routing support (/properties/$area), links are styled with navy blue color and hover underline from the brand palette, and smooth scroll behavior is implemented via CSS animations and useEffect hooks with 400ms transitions.

hallucinated_features.description: Breadcrumb navigation with 'Back to Home' button on PropertyListingPage
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest specified 'Navigation is clear and users can easily return to the main property listing view' but did not explicitly request breadcrumb navigation or a 'Back to Home' button. This is an implementation detail that exceeds the acceptance criteria.

hallucinated_features.description: Empty state handling with message when no properties match the selected area
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest did not specify handling of empty states or displaying messages when no properties exist for a given area. This is additional functionality beyond the specified requirements.

hallucinated_features.description: Full property details display including bedrooms, bathrooms, square footage, and pricing on the area landing page
hallucinated_features.reason: While REQ-12 requires displaying properties matching the area, the BuildRequest did not specify the level of detail to show. The implementation includes comprehensive property details that may exceed the minimum requirements.
